div.div: λαγχάνω , aor. ἔλαχον, λάχεν, redupl. subj. λελάχητε, perf. λέλογχεν: obtain by lot or by destiny, obtain, receive; abs., Il. 7.171; reversing the usual relation, Κὴρ λάχε γεινόμενον, ‘won me to her power at my birth,’ Il. 23.79; w. part. gen., Il. 24.76, Od. 5.311; causative, ‘put in possession of,’ ‘honor with,’ θανόντα πυρός, only with redupl. aor., *h 80, etc.; intrans., ‘fall by lot,’ Od. 9.160.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
